comment: The class was not that hard tbh, the professor was just very unorganzied. Every week you have a 10ish question quiz, with a midterm and final, all not-lockdown. Towards the middle and end you start having a lot of projects that can take hours to do, with instructions not clearly given. She is a very gentle grader though, so if you try its an easy A

You'll spend hours on assignments that the syllabus clearly stated had due dates/were graded then after the deadline for them she'll email saying it was optional or extra credit. Very project heavy and you ultimately don't know which ones you're getting credit for until after you do it. Seems like the professor is making it up as they go along.

Professor lacks any organizational skills. Every module has a due date that is different from what is stated. Lessons are jumbled. Currently three months into class and do not have a single grade in the grade book besides what McGraw-Hill automatically grades. Definitely would benefit from laying out a clearer timeline for students.
Do your work by the deadline because the professor will NOT take late work. Sometimes there will be assignments we will start in class... you will get lost.

This class was pretty easy. I don't have anything positive or negative to say about Professor Zaid. At time she does seem vague but it's not a big deal to me. Just do the assignments and this class was an easy A.
Would never recommend she had no clue what was going on and she wouldn't show up to class half of the time.
Doesn't know whats happening in the class. Easy class but she nor anyone else in the class knows whats going on.

She is terrible. She was always late to class and would sometimes not even show up. There are a ton of quizzes that are worth basically no points in the class. She was constantly changing due dates for stuff without telling us. She has no idea what she's talking about and on more than one occasion has to be corrected by her students. FIRE HER.

Does not seem to care about being a professor. Takes a long time to respond to students and doesn't seem to be well acquainted with the materials. It's obvious that she just reads the slides to us/doesn't do anything further to prepare learning material. Easy A but I wouldn't recommend her to anyone who would like to learn the from this course.
Wow I absolutely love this professor :D

I had never taken a class and learned absolutely nothing until I took this class. Professor didn't grade an assignment until mid April. Lectures were horrid and pointless and she comes in late to class half the time with a different excuse. She acts as if she has somewhere better to be and something better to do than teach the class. DO NOT TAKE!!

By far the absolute worst professor I have ever experienced. I am an honors student and I struggled because of how uninvolved she was with her class. She should not be allowed to teach. She sits on her phone half the class and then proceeds to read the words from the slides that are provided to her. I learned nothing from her. Please don't take her

This class is the worst class I have ever taken. I have never once received an email from her answering any of my dozens. I didn't go to class, likely every class but one because what she was "teaching" was the exact same thing as the $80 textbook that I am yet to ever open. I learned nothing in this class. Not a thing. Do not take this professor!

She is pretty nice and gives out easy grades. I would definitely recommend her if you are someone who just wants to pass the class and get it over with. You dont even have to show up, just do the assignments, submit them, and you'll pass.

Professor Obeidat is not very well acquainted with the subject. Takes long time to respond to email and after all does not provide a good explanation, instead she tells to refer to the text book and online sources. Do NOT recommend, there are way better professor out there. There is also a language barrier because of her accent.
I don't have much to say about her but my only advice for you is to not take her, I took her class it's very easy but I never learned anything. She is really not qualified to be a professor !

Just show up to class, do the unbelievably easy homework in class, and the incredibly easy tests, then use the online tests to answer all the questions on the final for an easy 100, and get the easiest A of your life.  You can't understand her very well, but you don't have to for a class this easy.
